intro: Selliguea hemionitidea, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, dense growth habit and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has a dark green to brownish color, with a wiry stem and small, ovate leaves that are often curled at the tips. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its ability to survive in harsh conditions. Selliguea hemionitidea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms in its ecosystem.
